quote: Medical log, Stardate 47879.2.  Major    Kira and I have completed installation    of the hospital facility at New Bajor --    the first Bajoran colony in the Gamma    Quadrant -- and are on our way home.
Could you take it for a while...
Sure.       Mind if I put on a little music...
Actually, I do... I was hoping to    meditate for a few minutes...
Of course.       I didn't know you meditate.
Every day.
I had the opportunity to study    meditation with Isam Helewa when I    was in college.
Remarkable fellow... he sort of took    me under his wing... I can't tell    you how much I learned from him...    the man was a master at rhythmic    breathing...
You'll have to give me a few tips    some time...
Gladly.    (beat, not wanting to     be rude)   And I'd be very interested in any    Bajoran meditation techniques you'd    like to show me...
We... just usually like to sit...    quietly...
What are you doing?
Bellows breath.  Thirty quick breaths    followed by one long intake of air    through the nose and hold.  Increases    the energy flow... here, it's quite    simple...
(no hopes for     meditation)   How about some music...
(reacts "already?"     then shrugs, "sure")   What's your pleasure?
I'm afraid my musical knowledge is    limited to Bajoran composers...
Computer, play us something by Tor    Jolan.
You know Tor's work?
I've made it a point to listen to    Bajoran music since I arrived.
Really.
Tor strikes me as the best of the    lot, wouldn't you say?... Slightly    derivative of the Boldaric masters    of the last century but pleasantly    diverting.
This is nice.  I'm glad we're finally    doing this.
What...
Talking to one another... finding    common interests... burying the    hatchet...
Hatchet...
A human expression... it means we're    finally putting our old conflicts    behind us...
To make way for brand new ones...
(thinks she's joking,     laughs)   Right.
You know, Nerys... may I call you    Nerys... ?
Sure.
Even when we weren't getting along,    I always thought you were... one of    the most interesting women I'd ever    met.
I'm very serious.
Thank you.  Doctor.
Julian.  Go on.  Say it.  Julian.
Julian.
It was hard for Chief O'Brien to say    too... we had a few problems    ourselves, you know... now we're    like this...
One minute to the wormhole.  Stand    by to drop to impulse.
Would you like to have dinner    sometime...
I think you'd better stick with Dax...
I'm sorry... ?       Oh, you thought that I was trying    to... no, no it wasn't meant to...
... my mistake.
... although, if I thought you'd    be...
... forget it...
...right.
Take us out of warp.
What's wrong?
The warp field's not fully    collapsed... I'm showing a plasma    injector leak...
The injector controllers are locked.     I'm trying to compensate...
What was that?
Initiating emergency stabilization    control.
Are you all right?
A little dizzy.
Me too.  I guess we're lucky to be    in one piece.
We'd better get O'Brien to take a    look at the...    (beat, reacts in major     confusion)   ... what the hell... ?
Where's the station?  What happened    to the station?
I've got it on long range sensors...    It's orbiting ... Bajor... ?
Major... vessel approaching on an    intercept course dead ahead!
I'm sorry, Ma'am.  We were not    informed you had left the station.
What is this?  Who are you?
We were on standard patrol when your    vessel seemed to appear out of    nowhere.  If you will allow us to    withdraw, we will escort you back to    the station.
That's impossible... I was as close    to her as I am to you... she cannot    be an imposter...
But she is.
(reacting to the     weapons)   What is going on here...
Garak... ?
Yes.  My name is Garak...
The question is...
... who are you?
This... may seem like an odd    question... but could you tell us    where we are?
This is the Terok Nor station, center    of authority for the Bajoran sector...
Center of authority... ?  Whose    authority?
The Alliance, of course.
You have no idea what we're talking    about, do you...
Listen, something is very wrong    here... I think we must've taken a    wrong turn in the wormhole...
Wormhole... ?
The wormhole to the Gamma...       This is very difficult to explain...    I think the best thing would be for    us just to get back on our ship and...
No, I don't think so.
Now, wait a minute...
Do not use that tone of voice with    me, Terran...
"Terran"... ?
If you are whom I suspect you are...    I'm afraid I can't take the risk of    letting you go...
Take that one downstairs.  Put him    to work.  Tell the supervisor to    keep an eye on him.  He won't know    the rules.
Intendant...
What is it you need, Garak...
This Terran was caught trying to    stow away on one of the freighters    leaving the station...
What is your designation.
Zero-four-one-three-Theta.
Theta.
Yes, Ma'am.
You've worked so hard to earn your    Theta designation and to earn our    trust... why do you throw it away    like this?
Reassign him to Lambda.  Send him    to the mines...
The mines.  But he should die for    this.  We should make an example of    him...
You've made a career out of making    examples, Garak... I think you enjoy    it too much.
He could not have gotten on board    that ship without some help.  This    is the third incident in a month.     At least allow me to interrogate    him...
Fine.  Interrogate him, but if he    dies during your interrogation...    you'll be my example.  Is that    clear?
Very, Intendant.
... if you don't upgrade the thorium    containment cells , there's    gonna be an accident and I'm not    gonna be responsible for the    consequences...
An extra worker for you...
A Terran who doesn't know the rules.
Well, we'll see to it that he learns    them.
What's your designation.
Bashir.  Julian.
Is that a joke?
I don't know.  Is it?
No joking.  That's my Rule of    Obedience, number fourteen.
Now what's your designation...
I don't have a designation...
I don't have a designation, sir.
Another Rule of Obedience?
I don't have a designation, sir.
I don't have a designation, sir.
Now why is that?
I don't know.  I don't know what I'm    doing here, frankly.
You're here to process ore.  Have    you ever done that before?
No, actually I haven't.
Have you worked in the mines?
No.
Well, what have you done?
I've been practicing medicine.
Did you forget the Rule of Obedience,    Number fourteen?
It wasn't a joke.  I'm a doctor.
A Terran doctor.
You and I are going to have an    interesting time together.  Doctor.
Be sure to scrub before you operate.
Sit down.
You are... me... aren't you.
I am Kira Nerys...
That makes two of us.
Where you come from, things are very    much like this, aren't they... there    is a station.  A Bajor.  Cardassians.     Terrans.  Klingons.
The players are all the same.  They    just seem to be performing different    parts.
You didn't seem to recognize the    "Alliance"...
No.
I'm sorry, I don't.

Interesting.  On my side, Kirk is    one the most famous names in our    history.       Almost a century ago, a Terran    starship Captain named James Kirk    accidentally exchanged places with    his counterpart from your side due    to a transporter accident.  Our    Terrans were barbarians then, but    their Empire was strong.  While your    Kirk was on this side, he met a Vulcan    named Spock and somehow had a profound    influence on him.  Afterwards, Spock    rose to commander in chief of the    Empire by preaching reforms,    disarmament, peace.  It was a    remarkable turnabout for his people.     Unfortunately for them, when Spock    had completed all these reforms, his    empire was no longer in any position    to defend itself against us.
Us?
The Alliance.  The historic coming    together of the Klingons and    Cardassians.
And Bajor is part of this Alliance?

We'd been under Terran occupation    for years.  When we were freed, we    petitioned for entry and were    accepted.  We've become quite an    influential power within the Alliance    now...    (Kira listens,     astonished, a beat)   Is it at all similiar on your side?
No.  My Bajor is not so fortunate.
I'd be very interested in hearing    more about it...
I can't stay here.  You must see    that...
Well, that's part of the problem...    I don't know how to send you back...    but more than that, there is a    protocol I'm supposed to follow...
I'm not sure what you mean...

After the first crossover, we were    afraid that others might come to    interfere in our affairs.  It was    decided long ago that if it ever    happened again, we would promptly    kill anyone who appeared from your    side.
I see.
Unlike my first officer, Mister Garak,    I have no taste for violence.  I    regret using it even when it seems    necessary.
I know exactly what you mean.
You do, don't you.
I know you don't want to kill me.     And that you're searching for a good    reason not to.
Got any ideas?

My side needs what you have.    (off her curious     reaction)   A strong Bajor.  If you knew the    struggles I've been through to rebuild    our world...       Who's to say you won't influence us    this time?
Me?
Our side once changed your course of    history... maybe this time your side    will change mine.  Maybe I can learn    from you what I need to lead Bajor...    if I can find a way to get back...
That I should have such an impact on    a place I have never even seen...       It appeals to me.
But I will have to kill your friend...

No.  Don't.  If you knew him... he    is an arrogant Terran who has lived    a privileged life on my side.  Now,    he can see how the other half lives.     You could influence his kind more    than anyone.
No, it's too dangerous.  The Klingons    and the Cardassians would never be    satisfied.
Are you the leader of this sector or    not... ?
You know how to manipulate me.
I know how I'd feel in your place.     I wouldn't give a damn what the    Cardassians or Klingons wanted.
You're right.  I don't.
Find this attractive young woman    some quarters.
I'll call for you later.
Do they ever feed you in this    universe?
The Intendant informed me that you'd    be inspecting the facilities... if    there is anything I can explain...
No, I've worked in ore processing    myself...
Is my Terran friend behaving himself?
They all behave themselves when I'm    in charge.
Good.  Good.  Do you mind if I speak    with him.
Are you all right?
I'm learning a new trade.  Do you    have any idea what's happened?
Did you ever hear of a Starfleet    Captain named James Kirk...
(immediately     understanding)   Kirk.  Of course, the transporter    accident... we read about it at the    Academy... that's where we are?
That's where we are.
Is there another me here?
Not on the station.  And I haven't    found Dax or Sisko...
O'Brien's been down here tinkering    with the machines...       Major, if Kirk got here using a    transporter, maybe we can get back    the same way...
I don't know anything about    transporters, do you?
No one knows more about transporters    than Chief O'Brien.
Our Chief O'Brien... who knows about    theirs... ?
It's worth a shot.
Talk to him.  I'll see if I can find    anyone else who might be willing to    help.
You certainly are the splitting image    of the Intendant... just as they    said...
Hello, Quark.
You know my name.
You run the bar on my side too.

Really.  I hope I'm doing decent    business.  Got to be better than    here.  The Alliance taxes are killing    me.  What can I get you...       The Intendant likes a hot jumja tea    this time of day.
Well, I'm not her.       But that does sound good.
Coming up.
So, are we close friends on your    side?
Yeah.  As a matter of fact we are.     On my side, Quark does me a lot of    favors...
Favors?
(testing the waters,     careful)   The Quark I know... well, he just    seems to have the ability to get    things done... when no one else can.     Know what I mean?
Sometimes he can even get things    done behind the backs of the security    people...
What kind of favors do you ask him    for...
Oh, all sorts of favors... getting    me things I need...
Such as... ?
Well, for instance, a transporter...    for a few hours...
Didn't I hear somewhere that a    transporter was involved in the first    crossover?
That's right.

Do you have a way back to your side,    Major?    (she looks at him     evenly, unsure who     to trust)   Under the right circumstances, I    might be willing to help you get    access to a transporter.
Look, Quark, I don't have a strip of    gold-pressed latinum to offer so don't    even think about it.
Gold-pressed what?
What is it you want...
The ability to send others across...    to your side...
Others... what others...
That's not important...
I can't open a revolving door to...
Mister Garak, what can I get you
You'll have to come with us.
Is there a problem?
Yes.  A slight problem.  You've    been helping Terrans escape from    the station.
Me?  I'm a simple barkeep... and a    coward... I assure you I don't stick    my neck out for anyone...
That's not what the Terran we caught    this morning told us during his    interrogation...
This is a misunderstanding... I    assure...
I'll miss him.  He always let me    win at dabo.
Bartender!
We just arrested him.
Arrested.  What a damned shame.
Who wants a drink on the house?
Miles O'Brien.
I know you... on my side.
Yeah?
We're best friends actually.
You and me?
That's right.
What am I -- some kind of doctor    too?
No, you're the chief of operations    of this station.
Me?  Gowan.
It's true.
(trying it on for     size)   Chief of operations.
You look like you know your way around    machines...
I know a few things... hey, what    else is he like?  This chief of    operations.
He's married, has a five-year-old    daughter... he's one of the most    decent men I know... we've fought    our way out of a few scrapes    together... I admire him a great    deal.
Sounds like he got the lucky draw    between me and him.
You ever do any work with    transporters?
Me?  Yeah, some.  Why?
The Chief O'Brien I know is an expert    in transporter technology.
I don't know if I'd call myself an    expert but I know as much as any    Terran...
I hope that'll be enough...
Enough for what?
We think a transporter may be the    way to get back to our side...
What.  You been filling me up with    this stuff just to get me to help    you, is that it... ?
No, everything I told you is the    truth...
Look, I don't know you.  I'm not    your friend...
I'm not your friend.
Meal break is over.
You're wanted in the bar.
If I don't finish down here...
You're wanted in the bar by Mister    Sisko.
(laughs, incredulously,     to his crew)   Look at this... do you believe it?       She called me back from the Fowla    System just to see you...
You not only look like her... you    have the same temper...
You and your friends don't seem like    the other Terrans I've seen here...
The Intendant has honored me with a    ship and a crew... and I honor her    by collecting duties... of a sort...    from vessels who pass in this    direction...
And why do you deserve special    treatment?
I suppose it's because I amuse her...    and she's not easily amused.       Although, you seem to amuse her too.
You wanted to see me, Mister Sisko?
(affectionate, but     patronizing)   Hello, Smiley, how are you?
It's Miles, Mister Sisko.
I don't like "Miles" -- that's why I    named you "Smiley."  They treating    you okay, Smiley?
Just fine.  What do you need?
You don't like me, do you, Smiley... ?
Not really, Mister Sisko.
And you're not afraid to show it,    are you... ?  I guess that's why I    like you so much.  My impulse driver    coil isn't operational.  Take care    of it.
I've got a serious problem down in    ore processing that's gotta be fixed    or it'll...
I don't care what you have in ore    processing, Smiley.  Fix my engine.
Kira to Sisko.
Go ahead.
There she is...
Have you met my friend Benjamin Sisko,    my dear...
Tell us -- is there another one of    him on your side... ?
Yes, there is...
Is he as loyal and true as mine?
He's a good man.
I'm sorry he didn't come with you.     Now, wouldn't that have been    something, Benjamin -- two of you by    my side.
I need to check on my ship.
Benjamin...    (he pauses at the     door)   Did I hurt your feelings?
I never had any to hurt,    Intendant.
Now what is this I hear about you    wanting a transporter?
Quark mentioned something about it    during his interrogation.
I did ask him about a transporter.     That's true...
But why?
You know I'm looking for a way back.     A transporter was responsible for    the first crossover...

And if you had come to me, I would    have told you that all the    transporters were redesigned    afterwards to make sure the same    thing could never happen again.  It    won't work.       So, why didn't you come to me?
You're... very busy.
You don't trust me.
I guess I am... a little... afraid    of you.
Then you fear yourself.
I don't want your fear.  I want your    love.
If you can't love me, who can?       Don't be in such a hurry to go.  I'm    glad you're here.  There's so much    we can learn from one another.
Intendant, Garak is here with the    prisoner.
Send him in.
He's made a complete confession and    implicated two others who have been    arrested.
Quark, I've always liked you, you    know that.
I have nothing but respect for you,    Intendant.  I am so sorry.
You did it because you felt sorry    for these Terrans... you hate to see    them suffer just as I do.
Yes, Intendant.
But where would we be without them...    who would perform the labor for the    Alliance?
A quick death.  Don't make him suffer    anymore.
No, Intendant.  Please.  I made a    mistake.  Have mercy.  Please.  No.     Don't do this... no, please... I'm    sorry...
I've planned a party for us tonight.     What shall we wear?
Lovely.    (he comes over to     examine it)   I do admire a well-tailored gown.
What are you doing in my quarters,    Garak?
She's never going to let you leave,    you know.       Can't you tell -- she's in love.
What are you talking about?

In love with you, my dear.  She's    all atwitter about you, speaks of    nothing else.  You are the perfect    gift for the girl who has everything.     She's taken you into her heart like    a Drathan puppy Lig left on her    doorstep.  Who else could she share    her personal secrets with... tell    her troubles to... trust with her    life.
All you have to do is look at the    guard outside to see how much she    trusts me.
I arranged the guard.       Oh, she trusts you.  As much as she    trusts anyone.  So who better to    betray her...
You're taking quite a risk coming to    me like this...
True career advancement requires    risk.  Consider my offer carefully,    my dear.  I will let you go.  She    won't.  If you want to leave, you'll    assist me...
How?
By taking her place.
What?
Tomorrow morning, she will be gone.
Gone?

She will be gone.  Don't make me use    some foolish euphemism.  You will    assume her place and announce that    your counterpart from the other side    has returned to wherever she came    from.  In a few weeks, you will step    down as Intendant to embark on some    spiritual journey to explore your    pagh or whatever... and I will take    your place as Intendant...
What about my friend...
The good "Doctor," yes.  He'll be    taken off the station and treated to    all the hospitality we Cardassians    can offer until you resign... and    then you can be happily reunited...
Oh, but I have made arrangements    with his supervisor that, if you    should decide to decline my offer,    tomorrow your doctor friend will    be... gone.
We have to get out of here tonight.
Why... what's happened...
I don't have time to explain.  Just    watch your back... you're in danger...
Why my back?  What kind of danger... ?
We have to find a way to get to the    runabout...
And then where do we go?  The Alliance    controls the entire quadrant...
There's still a wormhole out there    that they don't know about... I'm    not sure whether it'll get us back    or not... all I know is we can't    stay here any longer...
How are we supposed to get by their    security... ?
I'm trying to find some help...
I've been told Quark has helped some    Terrans escape...
We're a little late for Quark.  Stay    alert.  If our chance comes, there    won't be much warning...
Sisko.
Tell her I'm busy.
I have something important to tell    you.
I'm listening.
It's... valuable information and I    want something in exchange.
You've gone into business for    yourself, have you... ?
All I want is to get off this    station... I want my runabout    back...
And you expect me to help you?  She'll    have my head... or something else.
Not if you save her life.
Her life?
Garak is planning to kill her.     Tonight.
That's it?  That's the valuable    information?  Garak's been trying to    kill her since the day he got here.
He wants me to take her place...
Well, now, that's more creative than    he usually gets.       I wouldn't worry about it.
What kind of man are you...
(sighs, impatient,     eyes closed again)   You're disturbing my nap.
The Benjamin Sisko I know would never    sell his soul and allow himself to    become a part of this... tyranny...    against his own people...
Terrans don't have souls.  We don't    believe in them.
What do Terrans believe in?  Raising    their children to dig the ore out of    the mines for the Alliance?  I worked    in mines too until I was old enough    to start fighting for my freedom...
What do you care about Terran freedom.
I care about Freedom.  What I don't    understand is why you don't care...    why the only one I've met on this    station who seemed to give a damn    was a Ferengi toad named Quark.
You're looking in the wrong corner    for a hero, ma'am.  I've made the    best of a bad life for my crew.     That's my contribution.
Oh, sure... you've charmed your way    out of the mines... but you and I    both know... you're no less a victim    than anyone else here.
You are breathtaking tonight, my    dear.  I do hope you're planning to    save a dance for me later on...
... After four years as a    personal guard for the House    of Duras, I was ready to do    anything to get out of there...    you never knew what Lursa    and B'Etor were...
Clumsy fool.  Stupid Terran    pig!
What's wrong, Terran?  Lost    your nerve?  Afraid to die    today, eh?
Get out of my sight.
Play something bright.  I'm in a    happy mood.
You're picking up these skills quite    rapidly, Doctor.
It's a shame this will be your last    night on the job.
Engineering, we've got a thorium    leak down here...
Release the security locks!
Excuse me...
What's happening?
Your friend just killed his    supervisor... he's running around    the station somewhere.
Help us.
There's nobody around here foolish    enough to help now, Lady.
Nerys!
Leave him alone.  He belongs to me.
Establish security fields on the    levels above and below... station    guards at all turbolifts...
O'Brien, you've got to help me...
Look, I don't see you, you're not    here... I'm just trying to seal a    thorium leak...
I have no idea where I am... You    know the insides of this station,    don't you?  My Chief O'Brien does...
Just tell me how to get to the    Runabout pads...       I know you, Miles O'Brien... somewhere    inside of you is a shred of decency,    there has to be...
(strong, with     conviction)   I am a decent man.  I just... I    just...       Don't you understand... I can't help    you... I can't.  They'll kill me.
I'm sorry you don't see it.  You're    already dead, O'Brien.  The life    inside every human being... every    Terran... died here a long time ago.
That's not the right way.
Just tell me one thing.  Is there    any room over there... on your side...    for one more?
You want us to take you with us?
I got no reason to stay.
My people would have a big problem    with that.       The hell with them.  Let's go.
The new Terran killed the shape-shifter    and O'Brien tried to help him escape.
This is my fault for listening to    you... for keeping him alive in the    first place...
I know very little about where you    come from... but from what I've heard,   I think your kind has a lot to    learn...
We've got a lot to learn... that's a    laugh...
Shut up!

On this side, Terran workers do not    speak to their superiors as you do.     They certainly do not murder them.       He was the only one of his kind.     The man you killed.  Do you realize    that?  He is irreplaceable.  No one    ran that operation as efficiently as    he did.  No one kept order among the    workers as he did.       This is my reward for treating you    Terrans with the least respect.     Very well.  I can learn from my    mistakes.  You want to set an example,    Garak?  Use him.  Set an example.     For all Terrans.  Let him die slowly    in public view on the Promenade...    let his arrogant Terran voice pleading    for mercy echo through the corridors    for all Terrans to hear.
Intendant...
Another word from you and you will    die right beside him.
And you, O'Brien, you tinkerer and    putterer and fixer of broken    objects... you've been a perfect    theta for years... what could have    possibly gotten into you.  What were    you thinking?
Do you want an answer, Intendant?
Yes!

This man... this man is a doctor    where he comes from.  I'm supposed    to be some high up chief of    operations.  Me.  A Terran.  Can you    believe that?  Maybe it's all a fairy    tale he made up, I don't know.  But    it made me start thinking... how    different each of us might be if    history had been different just a    little...
If the conditions we live in were    slightly changed...

I wanted him to take me with him.  I    couldn't live like this anymore.  I    just figured whatever it's like where    he's from... it has to be better    than it is here.  There's got to be    something better than this.
Not for you, Mister O'Brien.  Oh,    he's going to take you with him.     But not exactly where you thought    he'd be taking you.
No.  I don't think so.
Have you lost your mind?
No.  I didn't lose it.  I just changed    it.
You know she's not going to let you    get away... she'll track you down no    matter how long it takes...
You may want to consider trying to    follow us back to our side...
I've got a feeling I might not fit    in too well over there... We'll stay    one step ahead of the sheriff, don't    worry about us.  Maybe we'll even    stir up a few things on this side...
You're still welcome to come with    us.
(considers it, then     glances at Sisko)   Sounds like I might have something    to stay for now... if you have room    on your ship for me, Mister Sisko.
I can always use a good tinkerer and    putterer.  Come on, Smiley.  You're    with me.
Good luck.  Thanks.
Disengage the docking clamps before    they lock on...
Confirmed...
Firing thrusters...
Thrusters engaged.
Taking us straight to impulse...
Impulse engines on line...
Sixty seconds to wormhole...
I'm still picking up a residual leak     from our warp core...
I'm just hoping that leak gets us    back where we came from... I'm    matching speeds and attitude     from our last time through...       Thirty seconds to wormhole...
Major... Klingon Bird of Prey    decloaking... coordinates one-five-   zero mark two-one mark zero-zero-   three... on an intercept course...
Shields down to sixty percent...
...Forty...
Ten seconds to wormhole...
We're hit!
Hold on!
Anything?
The search vessels picked up the    warp signature traces... there was    some indication of a warp core leak...
But no wreckage...
Nothing...
Reading elevated neutrinos,    something's coming out of the    wormhole... I can't believe it...    it's them!
They're showing damage to their    ...
Put them on the screen, Mister    O'Brien...
We've got ships from here to New    Bajor looking for you... where have    you been?
Through the looking glass,    Commander... it's good to be back...
